instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 Video issues
threads.message:
Hi.
This iMac turns on with no video. After a minute of being on the screen turns white then proceeds to login screen. After I login the screen turns black again. No external video whatsoever. 3 LED's lit on logic board. I also have another 21" that has been here for a while that is doing something pretty similar. Same year. Thanks have a good one.


***Also forgot to mention this has a new logic board installed. Thanks again.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 Video issues
threads.message: I did torch one to see if it would work temporarily but no such luck. Thanks dude.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 Video issues
threads.message: The one that only turns on after booting is probably a non original Apple card. A video card without an EFI BIOS will only work once the O/S has booted.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 Video issues
threads.message: It does do that. It enables when login screen is present. But once I login with password it goes black again and shuts down. Thanks.

threads.title: iMac 27" 2011 Video issues
threads.message: Someone bodged a PC card in there probably. Nothing to repair then
